result.execSummary:
The defendant Alex R. Simonsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay costs of the action. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: 60 days of sentence are stayed to be used at discretion of Court by petition of Dept. of Corrections. Huber privileges granted. 60 days to report.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alex R. Simonsen in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty plea to Count 3. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 3. Counts 1 and 2 are dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.
from SPD Regional Office Administrator advising that Defendant does not qualify for PD representation

ADDRESS INFO for Alex R. Simonsen

Change of Attorney
Pre-trial conference on October 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on October 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alex R. Simonsen in court with attorney Raj Kumar Singh. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant wants to seek private pay counsel, moves to withdraw and requests that Defendant have time to retain private counsel. Court suggests that cases be put on trial docket. State agrees, advises that 13-CF-89 should be set for sentencing, this case should be set for trial. Defense agrees, advises that Defendant has been found guilty on 13-CF-89. Court advises that Defendant will need to get counsel quicker in that case since sentencing is all that remains, may have to proceed without counsel if he doesn't retain counsel within 4-6 weeks. Defendant is seeking private counsel because he wants to fight everything. Court would expect successor judge to do inquiry into forfeiture of right to counsel if he hasn't retained counsel by sentencing. Atty Singh advises that Defendant wants to fight conviction on 13-CF-89. Court reviews record, finding of guilt in October, case is ripe for sentencing. Atty Singh questions whether PSI would be appropriate. Court doesn't feel it's necessary. State is not requesting one. Defendant wants one. Court orders PSI in 13-CF-89. Court grants motion to withdraw on both cases. Set for trial and pre-trial.
by Defendant

Defendant Alex R. Simonsen in court with attorney Raj Kumar Singh. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense will need time to get up to speed, requests status in approximately 30 days, will have firm course of action for proceeding at that time. Defense can appear by phone if he will only be advising Court to set case for trial.  Status conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Alex R. Simonsen in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions Defendant on status of getting attorney. Defendant advises that PD's office has not received file back from Atty Kavanaugh yet.  Status conference scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.
